name: Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Boil spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a pan, sauté onion and garlic until fragrant.
Add ground beef and cook until browned.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, season with salt and pepper.
Simmer for 10-15 minutes, then serve over spaghetti.

name: Grilled Cheese Sandwich
instructions: Spread butter on one side of each bread slice.
Place a slice of cheese between the bread slices, buttered sides facing out.
Cook in a pan on medium heat until golden brown on both sides.

name: Tater Tot Casserole
ingredients: 3/4 to 1 pound ground beef or turkey
1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup,        undiluted
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
In a large skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain.
Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer to a greased 2-qt. baking dish.
Top with Tater Tots.
Combine soup and milk; pour over potatoes.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake, uncovered, 30-40 minutes or until heated through.

name: Chimichanga
ingredients: 1/4 cup bacon grease or olive oil
2 cups shredded cooked beef, pork or chicken
2 cans (4 ounces each) chopped green chiles
Optional toppings: Shredded cheddar cheese, sour cream, guacamole, salsa, shredded lettuce, chopped tomatoes, sliced ripe olives
instructions: In a large skillet, heat bacon grease over medium heat.
Add beef, onion, garlic, tomato, chilies, and potato.
Stir in salt, oregano, chili powder, and cilantro.
Simmer until liquid has reduced, 2-3 minutes.
To assemble, place 1/2 cup off-center on each tortilla.
Fold up edge nearest filling; fold in both sides and roll up. If needed, secure with a toothpick.
In an electric skillet or deep-fat fryer, heat oil to 375°.
Cook chimichangas until golden brown, turning to cook all sides.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve with toppings of your choice.

name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Boil spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a frying pan, cook pancetta until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, Parmesan, Pecorino, and pepper.
Drain the spaghetti, saving a little cooking water.
Toss the pasta with pancetta and egg mixture, adding pasta water as needed.
Serve with extra Parmesan and black pepper.

name: Chicken Caesar Salad
instructions: Preheat the grill or pan.
Season chicken breasts with olive oil, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Grill or pan-fry the chicken until cooked through.
Slice chicken and toss with lettuce, Caesar dressing, and croutons.
Top with grated Parmesan and serve.

name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pan or wok.
Add onions and cook until soft.
Add the bell pepper, zucchini, carrot, and broccoli and cook for 5-7 minutes.
Mix together soy sauce, sesame oil, and honey, and pour over vegetables.
Stir to coat and cook for another 2 minutes.
Serve with sesame seeds if desired.

name: Chicken Tacos
instructions: In a pan, heat olive oil and add shredded chicken with taco seasoning.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring to coat the chicken.
Warm tortillas in the microwave or on a pan.
Assemble tacos with seasoned chicken, lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, sour cream, and salsa.

name: Beef Stroganoff
instructions: Heat olive oil and butter in a pan.
Cook beef strips until browned, then set aside.
In the same pan, sauté onions and garlic.
Sprinkle flour over onions and garlic, and stir to make a roux.
Add beef broth and bring to a simmer.
Stir in sour cream, mustard, salt, and pepper.
Return beef to the pan and cook for 5 minutes.
Serve with cooked egg noodles.

name: Vegetarian Chili
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pot and sauté onions and garlic.
Add chili powder and cumin, and cook for 1 minute.
Add beans, tomatoes, and corn to the pot.
Simmer for 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

name: Salmon with Asparagus
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place salmon fillets and asparagus on a baking sheet.
Drizzle with olive oil, and sprinkle with garlic, salt, and pepper.
Place lemon slices over salmon and asparagus.
Roast for 15-20 minutes or until salmon is cooked through.

name: Pasta Primavera
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions.
In a large pan, heat olive oil and sauté garlic for 1 minute.
Add bell pepper, zucchini, tomatoes, and peas, and cook for 5-7 minutes.
Toss the cooked pasta with the vegetables.
Top with Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper.

name: Eggplant Parmesan
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Dip eggplant slices in egg, then breadcrumbs.
Arrange in a baking dish and bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway.
Top eggplant with marinara sauce, mozzarella, and Parmesan.
Return to oven for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.

name: Chicken Fried Rice
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan and scramble the eggs.
Add cooked chicken, peas, and carrots, and stir-fry for 5 minutes.
Add rice and soy sauce, and cook for another 5 minutes.
Stir in sesame oil and green onions.
